County Government

  • Home
  • Government
  • County Government
Piscataway Township is one of the 25 municipalities within Middlesex County. 

Middlesex County is governed by the Board of County Commissioners which consists of seven (7) individuals, all elected at-large to staggered three-year terms, who act as the county legislators. Every January, the Board selects one County Commissioner to serve as Director and another to serve as Deputy Director. All County Commissioners serve as chairpersons and members of various committees to oversee County departments.

  • County Commissioner Director Ron Rios
  • County Commissioner Deputy Director Shanti Narra - Chair of Public Safety & Health Committee
  • County Commissioner Claribel Azcona-Barber - Chair of Community Services Committee
  • County Commissioner Charles Kenny - Chair of Transportation Committee
  • County Commissioner Leslie Koppel - Chair of Finance Committee 
  • County Commissioner Chanelle Scott McCullum - Chair of Economic Development Committee
  • County Commissioner Charles Tomaro - Chair of Infrastructure Management
There are also three (3) Constitutional Officers.

  • County Clerk Nancy J. Pinkin 
  • Sheriff Mildred S. Scott
  • Surrogate Claribel Cortes
To learn more about Middlesex County, please click here.

Contact Middlesex County

County Administration Building

  • 75 Bayard St,                     New Brunswick
  • (732) 745-3000
  • (732) 745-3454
